title: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference - via RPC sendRawTransaction
body:
I'm sending a raw signed transaction via web3.js (sendRawTransaction) into geth, I get an invalid RPC response (i.e. geth freaks out, and response badly).

I shouldn't be able to trigger an error like this should I (especially via web3.js RPC). My node keeps working after the error (i.e. continues to mine).

Thoughts? Let me know if you need the actual raw signed transaction. I figure, even if my keys are invalid and my rpc incorrect, the error should be handled properly, at least the geth console shouldn't look like what it does below.

In order to trigger this I set my gasLimit to '00' in the raw tx. When a gasLimit is set, the runtime error doesn't get triggered.

My keys:

```
{"address":"0x900d29e97b921a4f7682ad53517838a8efdd5b6f",
"private":"761626cf9de3d4d17e2b616d77f43e4dd864bf1db6fbc3d066460f791ba627fc",
"public":"d40266fc9a1072c31c7e49aa2045ab76d76fb704e1234148cda02d87584f121bbcfcc93512a6d7a185a4b74c6dc3a2737f577c36aef1f70a0387b44820ec4651"}
```

The GETH console response:


@SilentCicero can you please paste the sendRawTransaction command you used? I'd like to try and replicate this. Also, what version are you using? Did you try the latest bleeding edge code yet?
